{"blocks":[{"key":"356lk","text":"Insert the tube containing Standard #1 into the sample chamber, close the lid, then press Read standard. {"blocks":[{"key":"3ng3a","text":"Insert the tube containing Standard #2 into the sample chamber, close the lid, then press Read standard. When the reading is complete, remove Standard #2.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1e1ef","text":"The instrument displays the results on the Read standard screen. {"blocks":[{"key":"9k96d","text":"On the assay screen, select the sample volume and units:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8liij","text":"Press the + or – buttons on the wheel, or anywhere on the wheel itself, to select the sample volume added to the assay tube (from 1–20µL).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cs6nv","text":"From the unit dropdown menu, select the units for the output sample concentration (in this case choose ng/µL).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"937sm","text":"Insert a sample tube into the sample chamber, close the lid, then press Read tube. When the reading is complete (~3 seconds), remove the sample tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dutee","text":"The top value (in large font) is the concentration of the original sample and the bottom value is the dilution concentration. {"blocks":[{"key":"25u89","text":"Repeat step 14 until all samples have been read.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8latl","text":"Carefully record all results and store run file from the Qubit on a memory stick.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":10,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"dg6ed","text":"This protocol outlines the process of generating complete Hepatitis B virus (HBV) primers from DNA extracts for next-generation sequencing using Oxford Nanopore Technology (ONT). Specifically, we have designed pan-genotypic tiling primers to cover the entire HBV genome for sequencing. The hands-on time required for a batch of 48 samples is minimal, approximately 1 hour and 30 minutes. This protocol is straightforward and can be easily adapted in settings where the ONT protocol for SARS-CoV-2 has been implemented. We provide detailed instructions for PCR amplification using HBV-specific tiling primers, sample pooling, library construction using the Rapid Barcoding Kit (SQK-RBK110.96), quantification using Qubit, and subsequent sequencing on the GridION platform.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e78uu","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a91e9","text":"The Rapid barcoding protocol for up-to 96 samples \"PCR tiling of SARS-CoV-2 virus with rapid barcoding (SQK-RBK110.96)\" https://community.nanoporetech.com/protocols/pcr-tiling-of-sars-cov-2-virus-with-rapid-barcoding-sqk-rbk110/v/PCTR_9125_v110_revA_24Mar2021. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":120,"length":139}],"data":{}},{"key":"8fuhq","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"euj93","text":"This protocol describes a modified version of the 1200bp amplicon \"midnight\" primer set for nCoV-2019 (SARS-CoV-2) amplification, utilizing the Nanopore Rapid kit for MinION. The modification was developed by Nikki Freed. https://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.bwyppfvn and the original publication is found here : https://doi.org/10.1093/biomethods/bpaa014. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":222,"length":49},{"key":2,"offset":317,"length":42}],"data":{}},{"key":"cmi4s","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cpc04","text":"Primers were all designed using Primal Scheme: http://primal.zibraproject.org/, described here https://www.nature.com/articles/nprot.2017.066.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":47,"length":30},{"key":4,"offset":95,"length":46}],"data":{}},{"key":"6kj1h","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1fctp","text":"Primer sequences are here (and listed directly in the protocol)  :  ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"esgkj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"71CF40B109C211EEB4710A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://community.nanoporetech.com/protocols/pcr-tiling-of-sars-cov-2-virus-with-rapid-barcoding-sqk-rbk110/v/PCTR_9125_v110_revA_24Mar2021"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"4330789C09C411EEB4710A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.bwyppfvn"}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"D939B39B09C411EEB4710A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://doi.org/10.1093/biomethods/bpaa014"}},"3":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"E1BE9F5009C311EEB4710A58A9FEAC02","url":"http://primal.zibraproject.org"}},"4":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"E1BE9F9A09C311EEB4710A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.nature.com/articles/nprot.2017.066"}}}}

To ensure the integrity of your samples and prevent contamination, adhere to the following guidelines:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8p78n","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bbthm","text":"Designate a separate post-PCR workspace: Set up a dedicated area separate from where primers and master mixes are handled. Ideally, this space should be physically isolated or located in a different room to minimize the risk of contamination.","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"e9tt1","text":"Equip the workspace appropriately: Outfit the post-PCR workspace with equipment solely dedicated to handling PCR products. This includes pipettes, centrifuges, and any other necessary instruments. Avoid using equipment that may have come into contact with primers or master mixes to prevent cross-contamination.","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1qkf0","text":"Take precautions during tube handling: When working with PCR tubes containing amplified products, open them only within the designated post-PCR workspace. Be mindful of not spilling or splashing the contents, as this could lead to contamination.","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"c32rq","text":"Use separate lab coats, gloves, and other personal protective equipment (PPE): Designate specific lab coats, gloves, and other PPE items for use in the post-PCR workspace. This prevents the transfer of contaminants between different areas of the laboratory.","type":"ordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4oeh","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bm82t","text":"By maintaining a separate workspace and adhering to these precautions, you can minimize the risk of contamination and ensure the reliability of your PCR results.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cm5fr","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3j82n","text":"An alternative application for these amplicons is Oxford Nanopore Sequencing, specifically using Josh Quick's ligation-based protocol outlined in the CoV-2019 sequencing protocol v2. steps.section: Rapid barcoding using the RBK110.96 kit for 96 samples
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"feaia","text":"To accommodate multiple samples on the same flow cell, barcoding can be employed. Using the RBK110.96 kit, it is possible to run up to 96 samples simultaneously. Each sample's amplicons will be individually barcoded in the subsequent steps. It is strongly advised to refer to the current Oxford Nanopore Protocol for detailed instructions on these steps. As a tip, you can aliquot the Rapid barcodes into a PCR strip to facilitate multi-channeling. For comprehensive information, please consult the appropriate documentation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7942j","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"da1go","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"citation","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"align":"","authors":"Nikki Freed, Olin Silander","can_edit":true,"date":0,"doi":"https://protocols.io/view/sars-cov2-genome-sequencing-protocol-1200bp-amplic-bwyppfvn","guid":"357DED0009C011EEA4FAED8BA16C5EEF","id":0,"journal":"protocols.io","protocol_id":51951,"title":"SARS-CoV2 genome sequencing protocol (1200bp amplicon \"midnight\" primer set, using Nanopore Rapid kit)"}}}}
